summary: The Virginia Wilderness Additions Act of 2025 proposes to designate additions to the Rough Mountain Wilderness and the Rich Hole Wilderness in the George Washington National Forest. It amends existing legislation to incorporate approximately 1,000 acres into the Rough Mountain Wilderness and designates roughly 4,600 acres as a potential wilderness area for inclusion in the Rich Hole Wilderness. Management of the potential wilderness area will primarily follow the Wilderness Act, with exceptions for water quality improvement activities using motorized equipment under specific conditions.
